resources.string: This will delete all of your browsing history, and close any currently open tabs. Are you sure?
Zoom to a location on the map
Content is available under CC BY-SA 3.0 unless otherwise noted
By saving, you agree to the Terms of Use, and to irrevocably release your contributions under the CC BY-SA 3.0 license.

By saving, you agree to the Terms of Use, and to irrevocably release your contributions under the CC BY-SA 3.0 license. Edits will be attributed to the IP address of your device. If you log in, you will have more privacy.
This page is not available in other languages.
No languages found matching your query.
Your changes have not been saved yet. Are you sure you want to leave this page?
No results found in reading lists
To help protect against automated spam, please enter the words that appear below
Two-factor authentication required! Please return to the main activity and log in with your 2FA token, then retry.
Track what you\'ve been reading here.
Search and read the free encyclopedia in your language
Free access to Wikipedia is no longer active.

If your mobile operator waives data access charges for the Wikipedia app through a Wikipedia Zero partnership, leaving this setting checked helps you know when you are leaving the Wikipedia app and could be charged.
Data charges may apply. Continue to external site?
Your wireless carrier has provided free access to Wikipedia content!
Sync reading lists across different devices by saving them to your Wikipedia account
Sync reading lists across different devices by saving them to your Wikipedia account \"%s\"
This will completely delete all previously synced reading lists from remote storage. Remove all synced lists from your account \"%s\"?
Allow Wikimedia to collect information about how you use the app to make the app better
Allow the app to send crash reports to HockeyApp / a third-party service provider automatically so that we can review your crash and fix the bug faster and more easily.
Links to blocked domains (%s) detected. Please remove them and try again.
This page has been fully protected.
This page has been protected to the following levels: %s
Sorry, your account does not have sufficient privileges to edit this page at this time.
Sorry, this page cannot be edited anonymously at this time.
This app was translated by the volunteer translators at translatewiki.net.
Source code available on Gerrit and GitHub under the Apache 2.0 License. Unless otherwise specified, content is available under a Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike License.
The page has been modified. Are you sure you want to exit without saving your changes?
Your user account has been blocked from editing on this wiki.
Your IP address has been blocked from editing.
How did you improve the page?
Other ways you improved the page
This may be an unconstructive edit. Are you sure you want to publish it?
You cannot publish this edit. Please go back and change it.

An automated filter has identified this edit as potentially unconstructive. It may contain one or more of the following:

· Typing in all caps
· Blanking articles or spamming
· Irrelevant external links or images
· Repeating characters

An automated filter has identified this edit as potentially unconstructive, or potential vandalism.

Wikipedia is an encyclopedia and only neutral, notable content belongs here.
Are you sure you want to clear your search history?
Could not open web page (no browser app found).
Enable or disable loading of images in pages. Uncheck this setting if your Internet connection is slow, or if your data plan is limited.
Permission to write to storage on your device is required for saving images.
Are you sure you want to close all tabs?
Press and hold anywhere in the text to select it for copying and sharing.
After highlighting an interesting fact, try sharing it on your favorite networks!
See the table of contents anytime by tapping this button, or sliding from the right edge of the screen.
Response from the server was not formatted correctly.
Article cannot be loaded while offline.
Hint: Add the article to a reading list and it will be downloaded once you\'re back online.
You are reading an offline version of this article saved on %s.
You\'re reading the version of this article from %1$s • %2$s.
Could not find any apps that provide directions.
Show a quick preview of articles when tapping on links.
Sorry, voice recognition is not available.
Enable location permissions to see places near you.
The Android System WebView is currently being updated. Please try again in a moment.
Save data usage by loading articles that are available offline rather than always loading the latest version of an article
Access Wikipedia article packs (shown as .ZIM files) that have been downloaded to your device for reading when you\'re offline. Find out more
Would you like to send a crash report to HockeyApp / a third-party service provider so that Wikimedia can review your crash and fix the bug that caused it?
We\'re sorry, the Wikipedia app has experienced an error and was terminated.\n\nWould you like to start over or quit?
Add this article to a reading list
Drag the slider to change the size of the text that is used when reading articles. To set the text size throughout the rest of the app, change your system text size.
Switch to using the app\'s dark color theme
This article is already in that list.
Add articles to a list for reading later, even when you\'re offline.
Add articles to a list for reading later, even when you\'re offline!
You have no articles added to this list.
%s will no longer be available offline for all reading lists:
Articles saved to reading lists can now be synced to your Wikipedia account. Learn more
Reading lists can now be synced across devices. Log in to your Wikipedia account and allow your lists to be saved.
This will delete any previously synced reading lists from remote storage. Proceed?
The article is being downloaded, and it will be available offline when complete.
The chosen list already contains all of the selected pages.
Are you sure you want to delete %s?
Log in to allow your reading lists to be saved to your account.
Reading list sync is off for your account, and saved articles on your logged-in devices are no longer being backed up. Turn on reading list sync in Settings.
Articles saved to reading lists can now be synced to your Wikipedia account. Learn more
Articles were saved to the reading list while you were logged out. Would you like to add them to the reading lists in your account?
Yes, add them to my reading lists
Keep saved articles in the app?
There are articles currently saved in reading lists. Would you like to keep them there after logging out?
Default list for your saved articles
Create lists for places to travel to, favorite topics, and much more
There is a limit of %d articles per reading list. Existing lists with more than this limit have been split into multiple lists.
Can\'t add to this list. You\'ve reached the limit of %2$d articles per list for \"%1$s\".
Can\'t create another list. You\'ve reached the limit of 100 reading lists per account.

Sync reading lists

Reading lists can now be synced across devices. Log in to your Wikipedia account and allow your lists to be saved.

resources.string: %1$s left a message on your Talk page %2$s
Your edit to the article %2$s was reverted by %1$s.
%1$s thanked you for your edit on the page %2$s
Flip through random articles to read from Wikipedia.
Content cannot be loaded when offline.
Events in history on this day
Quick link back to reading an open article in one of your tabs
Suggestions based on a recently read article from your history
Daily featured image from Wikimedia Commons
Main page of Wikipedia with daily featured content

Customize your Explore feed

You can now choose what to show on your feed, and also prioritize your favorite types of content.
Thanks for your continued interest in editing descriptions! To make additional edits, please log in to your Wikipedia account.
By changing the title description, I agree to the Terms of Use and to irrevocably release my contributions under the Creative Commons CC0 license.
You just made Wikipedia better for everyone
You can also edit articles within this app. Try fixing typos and small sentences by clicking on the ^1 icon next time
Summarizes an article to help readers understand the subject at a glance
Ideally one line, between two to twelve words
By starting, I promise not to misuse this feature.
Title descriptions summarize an article to help readers understand the subject at a glance.
Descriptions should ideally fit on one line, and are between two to twelve words long. They are not capitalized unless the first word is a proper noun.
title description for an article about the Mona Lisa
title description for an article about Mount Everest

Descriptions are stored and maintained on Wikidata, a project of the Wikimedia Foundation which provides a free, collaborative, multilingual, secondary database supporting Wikipedia and other projects.
We know you tried your best, but one of the reviewers had a concern. Possible reasons your edit was reverted include:
your contribution didn\'t follow one of the guidelines.
your contribution looked like an experiment or vandalism.
If you are interested, see the edit history.
No internet connection. Make sure you\'re back online, then try again.
Permission to access storage on your device is required for offline browsing.
Permission to access storage on your device is required to use the Offline Library.
Permission not granted to read from device storage.
You are now browsing Wikipedia offline from article packs in your Offline Library.
With the Offline Library, you can now download packs of articles for reading when you have no internet connection available.
Are you sure you want to cancel downloading this article pack?
Do you want to remove this from your Offline Library?

“Article packs” in your Offline library are pre-packaged sets of articles for convenient storage on your device, so you can continue reading when offline.
Find out more
Article packs in your library remain available for reading when you are offline. Find out more
Want to save on data usage? Choose to “Prefer offline content” in Settings to show available offline articles first, even when you have connectivity. Go to Settings
Search results from your Offline Library
Download Wikipedia article packs now for data-free access later.
Keep on reading and searching for articles within your Offline Library when you don\'t have access to internet.
Download as much Wikipedia as your device can handle. Offline Library can also access article packs on external storage.

This Main Page provides an overview of the contents of this article pack.

You may also explore the contents of any article pack in your Offline Library by searching for available articles while you are offline.
Wikipedia is written collaboratively by volunteers and consists of more than 40 million articles in nearly 300 different languages. Learn more

Dive down the Wikipedia rabbit hole with a constantly updating Explore feed.
Customize the feed to your interests – whether it’s learning about historical events On this day, or rolling the dice with Random.
Create reading lists from articles you want to read later, even when you’re offline.
Create reading lists from articles you want to read later, even when you\'re offline. Log in or create your Wikipedia account to keep your reading lists backed up.

You can make reading lists from articles you want to read later, even when you’re offline.
Login to your Wikipedia account to sync your reading lists. Join Wikipedia
Help make the app better by letting us know how you use it. Data collected is anonymous. Learn more
